domain.title: Alternative/Supplemental Services
domain.description: The Alternative/Supplemental Services domain defines the model for a wide range of programs, including education programs, alternative programs, extracurricular programs, or supplemental programs. Programs are offered by an EducationOrganization and may offer services, as specified in the ServiceDescriptor. Students are associated with Programs via a StudentProgramAssociation. Staff are associated with Programs via a StaffProgramAssociation.

domain.title: Assessment
domain.description:
The Assessment domain defines a model that can be used for a wide variety of assessments, including state standardized assessments, college entrance exams, benchmark assessments and/or course assessments. The assessment domain is composed of the following subdomains:
Learning Standards
Assessment Metadata
Student Assessment Results

diagram.title: Assessment Core Standards
diagram.epilog: Many states have standard learning standards that drive the curriculum and the assessments. The Common Core State Standards Initiative (www.corestandards.org) is a national initiative for standards in this area. For states that use the Common Core, or have their own standards, the assessment model has entities for LearningStandard, which represents the lowest level of skills, and LearningObjective, which represents higher level aggregation of skills, as shown below. The model supports a hierarchical taxonomy of learning skills using multiple levels of LearningObjectives.

diagram.title: Assessment Metadata
diagram.epilog:
Assessment metadata is defined as all data that describes the assessment, as shown below. The model reflects four levels of definition, designed to accommodate a wide variety of assessment reporting, as follows:
AssessmentFamily – optional identification for a family of tests. For example, a family of statewide tests might be identified relating different subject assessments at different grade level. If required, AssessmentFamilies may be hierarchically organized. By convention, characteristics of an AssessmentFamily should be “inherited” by the individual Assessments.
Assessment – represents a specific assessment. The Assessment entity contains the minimum amount of metadata required for an assessment.
ObjectiveAssessment – optional identification of portions of the assessment that test specific learning objectives. If required, there can be multiple levels of hierarchical ObjectiveAssessments.
AssessmentItem – optional identification of the individual questions or items on a test to be scored.
Note that if the assessment references state standards for LearningStandards and LearningObjectives, then the assessment metadata would reference the preloaded standards. If the assessment references its own set of LearningObjectives and/or LearningStandards, then that data would be loaded as assessment metadata. An ObjectiveAssessment may test one or more LearningObjectives, and/or may test one or more LearningStandards.

diagram.title: Student Assessment
diagram.epilog:
The student’s assessment results follows a similar structure:
StudentAssessment – holds the overall assessment score and other information about the student’s results for a specific assessment.
StudentObjectiveAssessment – optionally holds the score for individually scored results on a LearningObjective.
StudentAssessmentItem – optionally holds the score for individual AssessmentItems.
The Assessment domain model is meant to adapt to support whatever level of results is reported for an Assessment.

domain.title: Discipline
domain.description:
The discipline domain model is fundamentally based the following major entities:
DisciplineIncident – represent the actions or behaviors that constitute an “offense” in violation of laws, rules, policies, or norms of behavior.
StudentDisciplineIncidentAssociation – links students to DisciplineIncidents and indicates their role in that incident.
DisciplineAction – represents the punitive or other actions taken against the students.
The model supports several flexibilities, as follows:
The BehaviorDescriptor holds the custom classification of discipline incidents for a School.
The DisciplineDescriptor holds the custom classification of discipline actions for a School.
When multiple students are involved in a DisciplineIncident, the optional association from the StudentDisciplineIncidentAssociation to the BehaviorDescriptor may be used when students have different levels of involvement, and therefore different offenses, for the same discipline incident (e.g., one might be the perpetrator and one might be an accomplice).
One DisciplineAction may be applied to one or more DisciplineIncidents (e.g., one suspension for multiple occurrences of fighting).
One or more DisciplineActions may be applied to one DisciplineIncident (e.g., suspension plus after school study hall). Alternatively, one DisciplineAction could have multiple DisciplineDescriptors associated with it to accomplish the same thing.

domain.title: Education Organization
domain.description:
The Education Organization domain defines the organizational structure of the education organizations within the scope of the Ed-Fi application. The entity EducationOrganization is an abstract entity, serving as an abstraction for common attributes and associations. The model supports the following structure:
StateEducationAgency – optional entity for the state department of education or equivalent.
EducationServiceCenter – optional entity for a regional organization between the district and state level.
LocalEducationAgency – representing a school district or charter management organization.
School – representing the point of education instruction.

domain.title: Enrollment
domain.description: The Enrollment domain represents students' enrollments in Schools, as specifically designated by the StudentSchoolAssociation.

domain.title: Graduation
domain.description:
The Graduation domain model is used to represent the following:
The student’s GraduationPlan, representing either a generic graduation plan for all or many students, or an individualized graduation plan. The GraduationPlan supports several levels of detail, including overall credit requirements, credits by subject area, or down to specific courses to be taken.
Significant PostSecondaryEvents, such as college applications and acceptances.
Awarding of the high school Diploma with associated honors and other recognitions.

domain.title: School Calendar
domain.description: The School Calendar domain represents the instructional days, sessions, and grading periods defined for a school year.

domain.title: Staff
domain.description:
The Teacher entity is a specialization of the Staff entity, having additional attributes and associations relating to their instructional duties. Non-teachers would be represented as Staff. The Staff domain represents a wide variety of staff information, including:
Employment information, represented by the StaffEducationOrgEmploymentAssociation.
Position assignments and roles, as represented by the StaffEducationOrgAssignmentAssociation
Staff attendance history, by representing LeaveEvents
Staff experience and credentials
OpenStaffPositions and whether they were filled

domain.title: Student Academic Record
domain.description:
The Student Academic Record domain represents the various kinds of student performance reporting, as follows:
Student transcript reporting course-level grades and credits
Report cards with grading period grades and competencies
Gradebook grades and competencies for classroom quizzes, test, home work, and projects
A student transcript consists of a StudentAcademicRecord associated with each Session which has a CourseTranscript for each course taken.

domain.title: Student Attendance
domain.description:
The Student Attendance domain represents both daily and class period (section) attendance. This model supports two approaches for collecting attendance data:
One attendance event for each student-section (or each student-day), reporting both attendance and absences.
“Exception only” reporting, providing attendance events only for absences and tardies.

domain.title: Student Cohort
domain.description: The Student Cohort domain represents a wide variety of collections of students that are different from class rosters or program participants. This could include students that are tagged for interventions or students tagged for the purposes of tracking or analysis, such as a principal watch list. Cohorts may be associated with Programs and may have Staff associated with the Cohort who is providing services, oversight or sponsorship.

domain.title: Student Identification and Demographics
domain.description: The Student Identification and Demographics domain represents the core information about Students and Parents.

domain.title: Teaching and Learning
domain.description:
The Teaching and Learning domain represent the following concepts:
The course catalog, representing the course definitions and course offerings available at a school each session
The student’s class enrollments in Sections and the Teacher(s) assigned to that Section.
Course represents the definition of the course, its characteristics and its mapping to LearningStandards or LearningObjectives. Course may be defined a State, LEA or School level. The CourseOffering is a Course that is offered by a School during a session. The CourseOffering will have a LocalCourseCode and may have a LocalCourseTitle.

domain.title: Career and Technical Education
domain.description: The Career and Technical Education domain extends the Alternative/Supplemental Services domain by extending the StudentProgramAssociation to specify the CTE program or cluster.

domain.title: Special Education
domain.description: The Special Education domain extends the Alternative/Supplemental Services domain by extending the StudentProgramAssociation to specify important data about the student’s participation in the Special Education Program. In addition, RestraintEvents are included.
